page.title: 05William Penn School. Coolham
page.content: Coolham Primary School, founded by Quakers (late 19th C.), renamed when resited 1973, has unique status as Society of Friends Controlled. It maintains this link through 2 Friends Governors and the Blue Idol Meeting House.The roll is 85 (5-11yrs.) drawn from Coolham, Brooks Green, Coneyhurst etc. Annual events include Harvest Service, Christmas Production in the Village Hall, Carols Around Tree at Goods' Stores, traditional May Celebr- ations with Maypole Dancing & Mayqueen ,a Fete and visit to the Blue Idol to dance and sing. During the year 84-85, Â£800 was raised for Oxfam's Ethiopia Appeal, and the Fete raised over Â£2000 for School Funds. Community involve- ment and support, particularly for{The {Domesday Project 1985,}visits and many extra-curricular activities are features of this small village school.
